Enum RegexHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<RegexHelper>
      • helper.RegexHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RegexHelper>

    public enum RegexHelper
extends java.lang.Enum<RegexHelper>
    Various methods to deal with regex extraction
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

      • extractRegex

        public static java.lang.String extractRegex(java.lang.String input,
                                            java.lang.String regex)
        Extract a single substring given by a regex pattern from a base string
        Parameters:
        input - A string from which to extract data
        regex - regex which must contain exactly one group in parentheses
        Returns:
        string which corresponds to the regex or null if no match was found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the input parameters is null

      • extractRegex

        public static java.lang.String[] extractRegex(java.lang.String input,
                                              java.lang.String regex,
                                              int numGroups)
        Extract n substrings given by a regex pattern from a base string
        Parameters:
        input - A string from which to extract data
        regex - regex which must contain exactly n groups in parentheses
        numGroups - the number n
        Returns:
        A string array of length n with all the requested substrings, or null if no matches of the requested numGroups were found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the input parameters is malformed.

      • extractNumber

        public static java.lang.Integer extractNumber(java.lang.String input)
        Extract a number from a string
        Parameters:
        input - a string containing an integer
        Returns:
        the first integer contained in a string or null if no integer was found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the input is null.

      • createWordPatternWLiterals

        public static java.util.regex.Pattern createWordPatternWLiterals(java.lang.String[] literalPatterns,
                                                                 java.lang.String[] words,
                                                                 java.lang.String... additionalSeparatorChars)
        Construct a pattern to match a string against a list of words / phrases and literary patterns
        Parameters:
        literalPatterns - a list of patterns (regexes) which shall be matched literally (i.e. without checks for word boundaries)
        words - array of words / phrases to match against
        additionalSeparatorChars - optional array of additional valid separators, must be correctly escaped; only single chars are allowed
        Returns:
        a pattern to match a string against the occurrence of any given word / phrase; contains exactly one group with all the input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is malformed

      • createWordPattern

        public static java.util.regex.Pattern createWordPattern(java.lang.String[] words,
                                                        java.lang.String... additionalSeparatorChars)
        Construct a pattern to match a string against a list of words / phrases
        Parameters:
        words - array of words / phrases to match against
        additionalSeparatorChars - optional array of additional valid separators, must be correctly escaped; only single chars are allowed
        Returns:
        a pattern to match a string against the occurrence of any given word / phrase; contains exactly one group with all the input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is malformed

      • getLeadingPhraseBoundaryRegex

        public static java.lang.String getLeadingPhraseBoundaryRegex(java.lang.String... additionalSeparatorChars)
        Parameters:
        additionalSeparatorChars - optional array of additional valid separators, must be correctly escaped; only single chars are allowed
        Returns:
        a regex chunk which may be inserted to match (0-width) beginnings of phrases (i.e. an improved version of \b)

      • getTrailingPhraseBoundaryRegex

        public static java.lang.String getTrailingPhraseBoundaryRegex(java.lang.String... additionalSeparatorChars)
        Parameters:
        additionalSeparatorChars - optional array of additional valid separators, must be correctly escaped; only single chars are allowed
        Returns:
        a regex chunk which may be inserted to match (0-width) endings of phrases (i.e. an improved version of \b)
